docs.title: ReResell Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the ReResell documentation. ReResell is a modern marketplace for buying and selling second-hand items, built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.

docs.title: Live Demo
docs.text: Visit the live application at recycle-resell.netlify.app

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• User Authentication - Secure login with email/password or Google OAuth
  • Listing Management - Create, edit, and manage listings with multiple images
  • Advanced Search - Filter by category, price range, condition, and location
  • Favorites - Save listings to your personal watchlist
  • Real-time Chat - Message buyers and sellers instantly
  • Offer System - Make and negotiate offers on listings
  • User Reviews - Build trust with ratings after transactions
  • Responsive Design - Mobile-first UI with bottom navigation

docs.text: Category Technology Framework Next.js 16 (App Router) Language TypeScript 5 Styling Tailwind CSS 4, shadcn/ui Database PostgreSQL (Neon Serverless) ORM Prisma 7 Authentication NextAuth.js v5 Storage Vercel Blob Real-time Pusher

# Clone your fork
git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/recycle-resell.git

# Install dependencies

# Set up environment
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your credentials

# Set up database
npm run db:push
npm run db:seed

# Start development server

docs.title: Authentication API
docs.text: Endpoints for user authentication.

docs.title: Register
docs.text:
Create a new user account.

POST /api/auth/register

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text:
{
  "name": "John Doe",
  "email": "john@example.com",
  "password": "securepassword123"
}

docs.title: Validation Rules
docs.text: Field Rules name Required, min 2 characters email Required, valid email format password Required, min 6 characters

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
Success (201 Created)

{
  "message": "User created successfully"
}

Error (400 Bad Request)

{
  "error": "User already exists"
}

docs.title: Sign In
docs.text: Authentication is handled by NextAuth.js. Use the built-in sign-in methods.

docs.title: Email/Password
docs.text:
POST /api/auth/callback/credentials

This is automatically handled by the NextAuth.js login form.

docs.title: Google OAuth
docs.text:
Redirect users to:

GET /api/auth/signin/google

docs.title: Sign Out
docs.text:
POST /api/auth/signout

Or use the NextAuth.js signOut() function.

docs.title: Get Session
docs.text:
Check the current user's session.

GET /api/auth/session

docs.title: Response (Authenticated)
docs.text:
{
  "user": {
    "id": "clm...",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "image": null
  },
  "expires": "2024-02-15T10:30:00Z"
}

docs.title: Response (Not Authenticated)
docs.text: {}

docs.title: Using NextAuth.js Client
docs.text:
In your React components:

import { useSession, signIn, signOut } from "next-auth/react"

function Component() {
  const { data: session, status } = useSession()

  if (status === "loading") {
    return <div>Loading...</div>
  }

  if (session) {
    return (
      <div>
        <p>Welcome, {session.user.name}</p>
        <button onClick={() => signOut()}>Sign out</button>
      </div>
    )
  }

  return <button onClick={() => signIn()}>Sign in</button>
}

docs.title: API Overview
docs.text: ReResell provides a RESTful API for all operations. All endpoints are located under /api/.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text:
• Development: http://localhost:3000/api
  • Production: https://recycle-resell.netlify.app/api

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Most endpoints require authentication via NextAuth.js session cookies. The session is automatically managed when using the web application.

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text: All API responses follow this format:

docs.title: Success Response
docs.text:
{
  "data": [...],
  "pagination": {
    "page": 1,
    "limit": 20,
    "total": 100,
    "totalPages": 5
  }
}

docs.title: Error Response
docs.text:
{
  "error": "Error message",
  "details": {}
}

docs.title: Listings
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description GET /api/listings List all listings POST /api/listings Create a listing GET /api/listings/[id] Get a single listing PUT /api/listings/[id] Update a listing DELETE /api/listings/[id] Delete a listing

docs.title: Categories
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description GET /api/categories List all categories

docs.title: Favorites
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description GET /api/favorites Get user's favorites POST /api/favorites Add a favorite DELETE /api/favorites/[listingId] Remove a favorite

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description POST /api/auth/register Register new user GET/POST /api/auth/[...nextauth] NextAuth.js handlers

docs.title: Upload
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description POST /api/upload Upload images

docs.title: Rate Limiting
docs.text: Currently, there are no rate limits implemented. For production use, consider adding rate limiting.

docs.title: CORS
docs.text: The API only accepts requests from the same origin. Cross-origin requests are not supported.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Complete reference for all environment variables used by ReResell.

docs.title: Required Variables
docs.text: These variables must be set for the application to work.

docs.title: DATABASE_URL
docs.text:
PostgreSQL connection string.

DATABASE_URL="postgresql://user:password@host:5432/database?sslmode=require"

Format: postgresql://USER:PASSWORD@HOST:PORT/DATABASE?sslmode=require

Providers:

  • Neon (recommended)
  • Supabase
  • PlanetScale
  • Any PostgreSQL provider

docs.title: NEXTAUTH_URL
docs.text:
The canonical URL of your application.

# Development
NEXTAUTH_URL="http://localhost:3000"

# Production
NEXTAUTH_URL="https://your-domain.com"

Important

Must match your deployed URL exactly, including protocol (https).

docs.title: NEXTAUTH_SECRET
docs.text:
Secret key for encrypting tokens and cookies.

NEXTAUTH_SECRET="your-super-secret-key-here"

Generate a secure secret:

openssl rand -base64 32

docs.title: Google OAuth
docs.text:
Enable "Sign in with Google" functionality.

GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID="123456789.apps.googleusercontent.com"
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET="GOCSPX-xxxxxxxxxxxxx"

Setup:

  1. Go to Google Cloud Console
  2. Create OAuth 2.0 credentials
  3. Add authorized redirect URIs:
  4. http://localhost:3000/api/auth/callback/google
  5. https://your-domain.com/api/auth/callback/google

docs.title: Vercel Blob Storage
docs.text:
Enable image uploads.

BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN="vercel_blob_xxxxxxxxxxxxx"

Setup:

  1. Create a Blob store in Vercel dashboard
  2. Copy the read/write token

docs.title: Pusher (Real-time Chat)
docs.text:
Enable real-time messaging features.

# Server-side
PUSHER_APP_ID="1234567"
PUSHER_KEY="abcdefghijk"
PUSHER_SECRET="xxxxxxxxxxxxx"
PUSHER_CLUSTER="us2"

# Client-side (exposed to browser)
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_KEY="abcdefghijk"
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_CLUSTER="us2"

Setup:

  1. Create account at Pusher
  2. Create a Channels app
  3. Copy credentials from App Keys

docs.title: Local Development
docs.text:
Create a .env file in the project root:

DATABASE_URL="postgresql://..."
NEXTAUTH_URL="http://localhost:3000"
NEXTAUTH_SECRET="development-secret"

docs.title: Netlify
docs.text: Add variables in Site settings → Environment variables.

docs.title: Vercel
docs.text: Add variables in Project Settings → Environment Variables.

docs.title: Docker
docs.text:
Pass variables via docker run -e or docker-compose.yml:

environment:
  - DATABASE_URL=${DATABASE_URL}
  - NEXTAUTH_URL=${NEXTAUTH_URL}
  - NEXTAUTH_SECRET=${NEXTAUTH_SECRET}

docs.title: Security Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Never commit .env files to version control
  2. Use different secrets for development and production
  3. Rotate secrets periodically
  4. Limit access to production environment variables
  5. Use secret managers for sensitive data in production

docs.title: Deploy to Netlify
docs.text: This guide explains how to deploy ReResell to Netlify.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• A Netlify account
  • Your code pushed to GitHub
  • A Neon PostgreSQL database

docs.title: Step 1: Connect Repository
docs.text:
1. Log in to Netlify
  2. Click "Add new site" → "Import an existing project"
  3. Select GitHub and authorize Netlify
  4. Choose the recycle-resell repository

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Build Settings
docs.text:
Netlify should auto-detect Next.js. Verify these settings:

Setting Value Base directory (leave empty) Build command npm run build Publish directory .next

docs.title: Step 3: Add Environment Variables
docs.text: Go to Site settings → Environment variables and add:

docs.title: Required Variables
docs.text:
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:pass@host/db?sslmode=require
NEXTAUTH_SECRET=your-generated-secret
NEXTAUTH_URL=https://your-site.netlify.app

docs.title: Optional Variables
docs.text:
GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=your-google-client-id
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=your-google-client-secret
BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN=your-vercel-blob-token
PUSHER_APP_ID=your-pusher-app-id
PUSHER_KEY=your-pusher-key
PUSHER_SECRET=your-pusher-secret
PUSHER_CLUSTER=your-pusher-cluster
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_KEY=your-pusher-key
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_CLUSTER=your-pusher-cluster

docs.title: Step 4: Deploy
docs.text:
1. Click "Deploy site"
  2. Wait for the build to complete
  3. Your site will be available at https://your-site.netlify.app

docs.title: Step 5: Update NEXTAUTH_URL
docs.text:
After the first deploy:

  1. Copy your Netlify site URL
  2. Update the NEXTAUTH_URL environment variable
  3. Trigger a redeploy: Deploys → Trigger deploy

docs.title: Custom Domain
docs.text:
To use a custom domain:

  1. Go to Domain management
  2. Click "Add custom domain"
  3. Follow the DNS configuration instructions
  4. Update NEXTAUTH_URL to your custom domain

docs.title: Build Fails
docs.text:
Check the deploy logs for errors. Common issues:

  • Missing environment variables
  • TypeScript errors
  • Dependency issues

docs.title: Database Connection Issues
docs.text:
Ensure your Neon database:

  • Is accessible from Netlify's IP addresses
  • Has the correct SSL mode (sslmode=require)
  • Credentials are correct

docs.title: Authentication Not Working
docs.text:
Verify:

  • NEXTAUTH_URL matches your deployed URL exactly
  • NEXTAUTH_SECRET is set
  • Google OAuth redirect URIs include your Netlify URL

docs.title: Auto-Deploy
docs.text:
By default, Netlify auto-deploys when you push to the main branch. You can:

  • Lock deploys to prevent auto-deploy
  • Set up deploy previews for pull requests
  • Configure deploy notifications

docs.title: Deploy to Vercel
docs.text: This guide explains how to deploy ReResell to Vercel.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• A Vercel account
  • Your code pushed to GitHub
  • A Neon PostgreSQL database

docs.title: Step 1: Import Project
docs.text:
1. Log in to Vercel Dashboard
  2. Click "Add New..." → "Project"
  3. Import the recycle-resell repository

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Project
docs.text:
Vercel auto-detects Next.js settings. The defaults should work:

Setting Value Framework Preset Next.js Root Directory ./ Build Command npm run build Output Directory .next

docs.title: Step 3: Add Environment Variables
docs.text: Add these environment variables before deploying:

docs.title: Required
docs.text: Variable Value DATABASE_URL Your Neon connection string NEXTAUTH_SECRET Generate with openssl rand -base64 32 NEXTAUTH_URL https://your-project.vercel.app

docs.title: Optional
docs.text: Variable Description GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID Google OAuth client ID GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET Google OAuth client secret BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN Vercel Blob token PUSHER_* Pusher credentials for real-time chat

docs.title: Step 4: Deploy
docs.text: Click "Deploy" and wait for the build to complete.

docs.title: Step 5: Set Up Vercel Blob (Optional)
docs.text:
For image uploads:

  1. Go to your project in Vercel
  2. Navigate to Storage tab
  3. Click "Create" → "Blob"
  4. Copy the token to BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN
  5. Redeploy

docs.title: Custom Domain
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings → Domains
  2. Add your custom domain
  3. Configure DNS records
  4. Update NEXTAUTH_URL to the custom domain

docs.title: Preview Deployments
docs.text:
Vercel automatically creates preview deployments for pull requests. Note that:

  • Each preview has a unique URL
  • Preview URLs won't work with NextAuth unless configured
  • Database changes affect production

docs.title: Production Checklist
docs.text:
• [ ] Environment variables are set
  • [ ] NEXTAUTH_URL matches production URL
  • [ ] Database is seeded
  • [ ] Google OAuth URLs are configured
  • [ ] Custom domain is set up (optional)

docs.title: Function Timeout
docs.text:
If serverless functions timeout:

  1. Check database connection
  2. Optimize slow queries
  3. Consider increasing timeout in vercel.json

docs.title: Image Upload Fails
docs.text:
Verify:

  • Blob storage is created
  • BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN is set
  • Token has read/write permissions

docs.title: Build Errors
docs.text:
Common fixes:

# Clear cache and rebuild
rm -rf .next node_modules
npm install
npm run build

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: ReResell uses NextAuth.js v5 for secure authentication.

docs.title: Sign Up
docs.text:
Users can create an account with:

  • Email and Password - Traditional registration
  • Google OAuth - One-click sign up with Google

docs.title: Email Registration
docs.text:
1. Navigate to /register
  2. Enter name, email, and password
  3. Password must be at least 6 characters
  4. Account is created immediately

docs.title: Google Sign Up
docs.text:
1. Click "Continue with Google"
  2. Select your Google account
  3. Account is created automatically

docs.title: Email Sign In
docs.text:
1. Navigate to /login
  2. Enter email and password
  3. Redirected to homepage on success

docs.title: Google Sign In
docs.text:
1. Click "Continue with Google"
  2. Select your Google account
  3. Redirected to homepage on success

docs.title: Protected Routes
docs.text:
These routes require authentication:

Route Description /dashboard User dashboard /listing/create Create new listing /favorites Saved listings /chat Messages /profile Edit profile /offers Sent/received offers

Unauthenticated users are redirected to /login with a callback URL.

docs.title: Session Management
docs.text:
• Sessions use JWT tokens stored in HTTP-only cookies
  • Sessions expire after 30 days
  • Users can sign out from the header menu

docs.title: User Profile
docs.text:
After authentication, users have access to:

  • Name - Display name
  • Email - Login email (cannot be changed)
  • Profile Image - From Google or uploaded
  • Bio - Optional description
  • Location - Default meetup location

docs.title: Security Features
docs.text:
• Password Hashing - bcrypt with salt rounds
  • CSRF Protection - Built into NextAuth.js
  • Secure Cookies - HTTP-only, secure in production
  • OAuth State - Prevents CSRF on OAuth flows

docs.title: Implementing Auth in Components
docs.text:
// Check auth status
import { useSession } from "next-auth/react"

function Component() {
  const { data: session, status } = useSession()

  if (status === "loading") return <Loading />
  if (!session) return <SignInPrompt />

  return <AuthenticatedContent user={session.user} />
}

// Server component
import { auth } from "@/lib/auth"

async function Page() {
  const session = await auth()

  if (!session) {
    redirect("/login")
  }

  return <Content />
}

docs.title: Favorites

docs.title: From Listing Card

  3. Listing is added to favorites

Navigate to /favorites to see all saved listings.

Features:

  • Grid view of favorited listings
  • Quick access to listing details
  • Remove from favorites
  • See current status (available/sold)

docs.title: From Listing Card
docs.text:
1. Click the filled heart icon
  2. Listing is removed

docs.title: From Favorites Page
docs.text:
1. Go to /favorites
  2. Click the heart icon on any listing
  3. Listing is removed

docs.title: Listings
docs.text: Create and manage marketplace listings.

docs.title: Creating a Listing
docs.text:
1. Click "Start selling" or navigate to /listing/create
  2. Sign in if not already authenticated
  3. Fill in the listing details

docs.title: Required Fields
docs.text: Field Description Title 3-100 characters Description 10-5000 characters Price Amount in SGD Category Select from available categories Condition Item condition Location Meetup location Images At least 1 image (max 10)

docs.title: Condition Options
docs.text: Condition Description New Brand new, unused Like New Excellent condition, barely used Good Good condition, minor wear Fair Fair condition, visible wear Poor Poor condition, significant wear

docs.title: Optional Fields
docs.text:
• Brand - Item brand name
  • Tags - Keywords for search
  • Delivery - Can deliver / meetup only
  • Delivery Fee - If delivery is available

docs.title: Uploading Images
docs.text:
• Drag and drop or click to upload
  • Supported formats: JPG, PNG, WebP
  • Maximum 10 images per listing
  • First image is the cover photo
  • Reorder by dragging

docs.title: Listing Status
docs.text: Status Description Available Active and visible Reserved Reserved for a buyer Sold Transaction completed Draft Not published

docs.title: View Your Listings
docs.text:
• Navigate to /listings or user profile
  • See all your listings with status

docs.title: Edit a Listing
docs.text:
1. Click on your listing
  2. Click "Edit"
  3. Make changes
  4. Save

docs.title: Delete a Listing
docs.text:
1. Click on your listing
  2. Click "Delete"
  3. Confirm deletion

docs.title: Mark as Sold
docs.text:
1. Click on your listing
  2. Click "Mark as Sold"
  3. Select the buyer (if from chat)

docs.title: Listing Detail Page
docs.text:
The listing detail page shows:

  • Image gallery with carousel
  • Title, price, condition
  • Description
  • Seller information
  • Location
  • Action buttons (Contact, Favorite)

docs.title: Good Titles
docs.text:
• Be specific: "iPhone 14 Pro 256GB Space Black"
  • Include key details
  • Avoid ALL CAPS

docs.title: Good Descriptions
docs.text:
• Describe condition honestly
  • List any defects
  • Include dimensions if relevant
  • Mention original accessories

docs.title: Good Photos
docs.text:
• Use good lighting
  • Show all angles
  • Include close-ups of defects
  • Use clean backgrounds

docs.title: Search & Filters
docs.text: Find items quickly with powerful search and filtering.

docs.title: Basic Search
docs.text:
1. Use the search bar in the header
  2. Enter keywords (title, description, brand)
  3. Press Enter or click search

docs.title: Search Tips
docs.text:
• Use specific terms: "MacBook Pro M2" vs "laptop"
  • Include brand names for better results
  • Try different keywords if no results

docs.title: Filters
docs.text: Access filters on the /search page.

docs.title: Category Filter
docs.text:
Filter by category:

  • Electronics
  • Fashion
  • Home & Living
  • Sports
  • Books
  • Vehicles
  • Services
  • Others

docs.title: Price Range
docs.text:
Set minimum and/or maximum price:

  • Min: 0+
  • Max: Any amount
  • Leave empty for no limit

docs.title: Condition
docs.text:
Filter by item condition:

  • Fair

Multiple conditions can be selected.

docs.title: Location

docs.title: Sorting
docs.text:
Sort results by:

Option Description Most Recent Newest listings first Price: Low to High Cheapest first Price: High to Low Most expensive first Most Popular Most likes first

docs.text:
Search state is reflected in the URL:

/search?q=iphone&category=electronics&minPrice=100&maxPrice=500&condition=LIKE_NEW&sort=price-low

Parameters:

Parameter Description q Search query category Category slug minPrice Minimum price maxPrice Maximum price condition Condition filter sort Sort order page Page number

docs.title: Mobile Experience
docs.text:
On mobile devices:

  1. Tap the filter button
  2. Filters open in a slide-out sheet
  3. Set your filters
  4. Tap "Apply Filters"

docs.title: Pagination
docs.text:

docs.title: No Results
docs.text:
If no listings match your search:

  • Try broader search terms
  • Remove some filters
  • Check spelling
  • Browse categories instead

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: This guide explains all the environment variables used by ReResell.

docs.title: Database
docs.text:
DATABASE_URL="postgresql://user:password@host/database?sslmode=require"

The PostgreSQL connection string. We recommend using Neon for serverless PostgreSQL.

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
NEXTAUTH_URL="http://localhost:3000"
NEXTAUTH_SECRET="your-secret-key"
  • NEXTAUTH_URL: Your application URL (use http://localhost:3000 for development)
  • NEXTAUTH_SECRET: A random string for encrypting tokens. Generate with:
openssl rand -base64 32

docs.title: Google OAuth
docs.text:
GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID="your-client-id.apps.googleusercontent.com"
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET="your-client-secret"

To enable Google sign-in:

  1. Go to Google Cloud Console
  2. Create a new project or select existing
  3. Enable the Google+ API
  4. Go to Credentials → Create Credentials → OAuth Client ID
  5. Set authorized redirect URIs:
  6. Development: http://localhost:3000/api/auth/callback/google
  7. Production: https://your-domain.com/api/auth/callback/google

docs.title: Image Storage (Vercel Blob)
docs.text:
BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN="vercel_blob_..."

For image uploads:

  1. Go to Vercel Dashboard
  2. Select your project → Storage → Create Database → Blob
  3. Copy the BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN

docs.title: Real-time Chat (Pusher)
docs.text:
PUSHER_APP_ID="your-app-id"
PUSHER_KEY="your-key"
PUSHER_SECRET="your-secret"
PUSHER_CLUSTER="us2"
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_KEY="your-key"
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_CLUSTER="us2"

For real-time messaging:

  1. Create an account at Pusher
  2. Create a new Channels app
  3. Copy the credentials from App Keys

docs.title: Environment File Example
docs.text:
# Database (Neon PostgreSQL)
DATABASE_URL="postgresql://neondb_owner:xxx@ep-xxx.neon.tech/neondb?sslmode=require"

# NextAuth.js
NEXTAUTH_URL="http://localhost:3000"
NEXTAUTH_SECRET="your-generated-secret-key"

# Google OAuth (optional)
GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=""
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=""

# Pusher (optional)
PUSHER_APP_ID=""
PUSHER_KEY=""
PUSHER_SECRET=""
PUSHER_CLUSTER=""
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_KEY=""
NEXT_PUBLIC_PUSHER_CLUSTER=""

# Vercel Blob Storage (optional)
BLOB_READ_WRITE_TOKEN=""

docs.title: Production Considerations
docs.text:
Security

Never commit your .env file to version control. It's already in .gitignore.

For production deployments:

  1. Use strong, randomly generated secrets
  2. Update NEXTAUTH_URL to your production domain
  3. Update Google OAuth redirect URIs
  4. Consider using environment variable encryption

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This guide will help you set up ReResell on your local machine.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed:

  • Node.js 18.0 or higher
  • npm or yarn package manager
  • Git for version control

You'll also need:

  • A PostgreSQL database (we recommend Neon for serverless PostgreSQL)
  • A Vercel account (optional, for image uploads)
  • A Pusher account (optional, for real-time chat)

docs.title: Step 1: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/alfredang/recycle-resell.git
cd recycle-resell

docs.title: Step 2: Install Dependencies
docs.text:
npm install

This will install all required dependencies including:

  • Next.js and React
  • Prisma ORM
  • NextAuth.js
  • Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui components
  • And other supporting libraries

docs.title: Step 3: Set Up Environment Variables
docs.text:
Copy the example environment file:

cp .env.example .env

Edit the .env file with your credentials. See the Configuration guide for details on each variable.

docs.title: Using Neon (Recommended)
docs.text:
1. Create a free account at neon.tech
  2. Create a new project
  3. Copy the connection string to your .env file

docs.title: Push the Schema
docs.text:
npm run db:push

This creates all the necessary database tables.

docs.title: Seed Sample Data
docs.text:
npm run db:seed

This populates the database with:

  • 8 categories
  • 3 test users
  • 10 sample listings

docs.title: Step 5: Start the Development Server
docs.text:
npm run dev

Open http://localhost:3000 in your browser.

docs.title: Database Connection Issues
docs.text:
If you see connection errors:

  1. Verify your DATABASE_URL is correct
  2. Ensure your database allows connections from your IP
  3. Check that SSL mode is set correctly (?sslmode=require)

docs.title: Build Errors
docs.text:
If you encounter build errors:

# Clear Next.js cache
rm -rf .next

# Regenerate Prisma client
npx prisma generate

# Rebuild
npm run build
